conclusion: Problem analysis with given parameters from Figure C
Conveyor length is 6 m, speed is 2 m/s clockwise, kinetic friction coefficient is 0.2, gravitational acceleration is 10 m/s², cargo starts from rest at the left end
Identify forces acting on cargo A: normal force upward, weight downward, friction force in direction of conveyor's motion
Apply Newton's Second Law: friction force accelerates cargo in direction of conveyor
Friction force is given by F_f = μ_1 N, and N = mg since no vertical acceleration
Calculate friction force: F_f = μ_1 mg
Using Newton's Second Law in horizontal direction: F_f = ma, so μ_1 mg = ma
Calculate acceleration: a = μ_1 g = 0.2 × 10 m/s² = 2 m/s²
Calculate time to travel from left to right using kinematic equation s = ut + 1/2 at²
Substitute values into kinematic equation: 6 = 0 × t + 1/2 × 2 × t², solve for t
Final answer: acceleration is 2 m/s², time to travel is 2.45 seconds
